greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. satisfies A(x) = A(A(x)) - x^2 with A(0)=0.
formula: G.f. satisfies: A(x) = x + x^2*exp( 2*Sum_{n>=0} [d^n/dx^n (x-A(x))^(n+1)/x]/(n+1)! ). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 24 2011
Let G(x) = Series_Reversion(A(x)) = g.f. of A139702, then G(x)^2 = A(x) - x so that G(x + G(x)^2) = x.
example: Higher order iterations of A=A(x) may be expressed in terms of A and x:
The sums of coefficients in the above expansions form A000278: [1,1,2,3,7,16,65,321,4546,107587,20773703,...].
Let G(x) = Series_Reversion(A(x)) = g.f. of A139702, then
so that G(x)^2 = A(x) - x and G(x + G(x)^2) = x.
program: {a(n)=local(A=x+x^2+x*O(x^n)); for(i=1, n, A=x+x^2*exp(2*sum(m=0, n, Dx(m, (x-A)^(m+1)/x)/(m+1)!)+x*O(x^n))); polcoeff(A, n)}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 26 2008, Mar 27 2008, Apr 30 2008
